meanings.definition: To cool (a liquid) below its freezing point without solidification.
meanings.sent1: The scientist supercooled the water to study its properties.
meanings.sent2: They supercooled the juice to make a refreshing slushy.
meanings.sent3: The supercooled soda refused to turn into ice, much to the disappointment of the party guests.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor was like a supercooled lake, hiding the turmoil beneath the surface.
meanings.sent5: The supercooled liquid shimmered with an otherworldly glow, captivating all who saw it.

meanings.definition: A liquid cooled below its freezing point without solidification.
meanings.sent1: The supercooled water formed beautiful icicles on the roof.
meanings.sent2: The supercooled liquid was used in the experiment to observe its behavior.
meanings.sent3: The supercooled milk in the fridge looked like a magical potion waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were as clear and cold as a supercooled lake on a winter morning.
meanings.sent5: The supercooled solution held the key to unlocking a new scientific breakthrough.
